Siouxsie Wiles: Auckland University ordered to pay $20,000 in Employment Court decision https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/siouxsie-wiles-auckland-university-ordered-to-pay-20000-in-employment-court-decision/AT7N5ME66JA2NC4DFB2EPYCFME/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/siouxsie-wiles-auckland-university-ordered-to-pay-20000-in-employment-court-decision/AT7N5ME66JA2NC4DFB2EPYCFME/ Benjamin Plummer, Isaac DavisonThe Employment Court has issued its judgment in Siouxsie Wiles' case against her employer. Photo / Loading Docs
Tribunal: Kiwi lawyer, who also works for Government, cleared of wrongdoing for conduct in Australian court custody battle for stepdaughter https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/government-lawyer-cleared-of-wrongdoing-for-conduct-in-australian-family-court/K6CUYUZM2VCMRKJNVBGFBL3VRE/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/government-lawyer-cleared-of-wrongdoing-for-conduct-in-australian-family-court/K6CUYUZM2VCMRKJNVBGFBL3VRE/ Jeremy WilkinsonThe man was embroiled in an international custody battle for his stepdaughter. Mon, 08 Jul 2024 06:00:00 +0000 The man was engaged in a custody dispute in the Australian Family Court. Photo / 123RF
New Zealand leads world’s first trade agreement between indigenous people https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/new-zealand-leads-worlds-first-trade-agreement- Between-indigenous-people/2K2RISJIL5FXHKOAZHXABSMNKA/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/new-zealand-leads-worlds-first-trade-agreement- Between-indigenous-people/2K2RISJIL5FXHKOAZHXABSMNKA/ Denise PiperThe arrangement helped US and Canadian indigenous people meet for the first time. Mon, 08 Jul 2024 06:00:00 +0000 The Indigenous Peoples Economic and Trade Co-operation Arrangement, IPETCA, meeting in Vancouver in June was the first indigenous trade meeting between the United States and Canada. Pictured from left is indigenous co-chairwoman Traci Houpapa, US Consul General to Canada James DeHart, Lieutenant Governor of Minnesota Penny Flanagan, US Ambassador to Canada David Cohen, indigenous co-chairman Pita Tipene and co-chairman Tāne Waetford from the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade.
Auckland Airport meth import case: verdict in Nigel Iuvale, Tungane Manuel trial https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/auckland-airport-meth-import-case-verdict-in-nigel-iuvale-tungane-manuel-Trial/MYJ6CISXHZHZ5G2AAARFGMS4XE/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/auckland-airport-meth-import-case-verdict-in-nigel-iuvale-tungane-manuel-trial/MYJ6CISXHZHZ5G2AAARFGMS4XE/ Craig Kapitan, George BlockAuthorities said the alleged kingpin's syndicate was at first extremely successful. Mon, 08 Jul 2024 05:59:59 +0000 Alleged methamphetame trafficking syndicate leader Nigel Iuvale appears in the High Court at Auckland at the start of the Operation Selena jury trial. He is accused of having co-ordinated the illegal smuggling of hundreds of kilograms of the drug with the help of Auckland Airport baggage handlers. Photo / Jason Oxenham

Tauranga District Court case: Jafar Kurisi’s crowdfunded reparation keeps him out of jail for illegal migrant exploitation https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/tauranga-district-court-case-jafar-kurisis-crowdfunded-reparation-keeps-him-out-of-jail-for-illegal-migrant-exploitation/Y3SJMN7WV5AI7AAY6A5Y7DTICM/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/tauranga-district-court-case-jafar-kurisis-crowdfunded-reparation-keeps-him-out-of-jail-for-illegal-migrant-exploitation/Y3SJMN7WV5AI7AAY6A5Y7DTICM/ Hannah BartlettAround 19 workers were housed in a garage for four months.
